text:
if you are interested in ethereum in more depth, the cryptocurrency decal course is doing an intro tomorrow. 
4-5pm and 7-8pm, in Soda Hall 310
<https://bitcoin.berkeley.edu/decal>
^ lots of good resources there if you’re interested in this stuff broadly
<!channel> please DM me if there are topics related to bitcoin/cryptocurrency/blockchain you would like to review or discuss at the lab tomorrow
topics so far: wtf is the blockchain, so we’ll definitely cover that
<@U1HAU35L1> I still don’t get if the blockchain would replace institutions like the central bank or just be a second venmo… so if we could talk about that in a bit more clarity that would be great.
i think the answer is both, kind of
also, why would you give so much money to the miners? it seems to be the only way money is put into the system… ???
but i think i need to look into how financial markets currently work before I can really understand any answer
i’ll put that at the end, central banks are complicated beasts that serve a variety of functions
i’ll also do my best not to pontificate and push my saltwater keynsian views on you all, but it will be hard for me not to :slightly_smiling_face:
I’m sure quite a few of us did macro, just need to brush up on some of the financial concepts i guess
show us how to be millionaires <@U1HAU35L1>
<@U1HAU35L1>: I'm confused as to how all this money gets generated, for example with Ethereum, and if it is only through miners
<@U1HAU35L1> I'm not sure about the significance of the year that Doug kept mentioning that it would end by then

there is a guest speaker in SDR class talking about blockchain..
if anyone is interested.
